text: (cheerful music)
- I am Sridhar Dasika.

I work as a senior software
developer at AWS Infrastructure.
(cheerful music continues)

Before AWS, I was in
software for chip design.
But one of the things that was missing
was working with scale
and having that large scale impact.
As a child,

one of the things that I really
loved was building stuff.
So I used to make my own bow and arrows
and things like that.
So I always wanted to be a builder.
(cheerful music continues)

You actually build and own
really complex, huge system
with a very high customer impact.

So exciting happening,
dynamic work environment.
There is never a dull day.
During my role at AWS.

I've seen that you're given
that space to take risks.
So that's another key thing

to be able to take risk
and move really quickly.
To be able to go from an ideation phase,
to actually seeing it implemented
and deployed to a customer.

And this happens like in a
period of six to eight weeks.

And you can actually see whatever
you do used by a customer.

So that brings in a huge
sense of fulfillment

in what you do, like what
you do actually matters
and makes real world impact.
(cheerful music continues)
